title: Using extended-duration audio recordings to survey avian species
comments: for alpha richness, only using 36 sites for which asymptote was reached, requested full data set and clarification concerning improvement of SnR with horns. Paper seems to mention richness per count and not per site, height data from personal communication (phone with author), gamma point count richness in the text do not add up, counted species from table 1 instead
radius_justification: range of microphones deemed similar to human ear
microphone: PA3 mini microphones (MG Electronics, Hauppauge, NY)
snr_source: manufacturer specifications: 58 dB. However signal-to-noise ratio was improved by their horns: "We fitted microphones into a custom 4-horn arrangement that increased gain omni-directionally in the ground plane of the meadows (Tegeler-Amones 2008)". Bjorn Kolbrek, with horn dimensions estimated from A Tegeler's horn picture in the PhD thesis (20 cm large at the mouth, 4 cm at the throat, exponential shape, and length from throat to mouth of 20 cm.), estimated 12-14 dB amplification in range between 2-5 kHz kHz.
